meanings.definition: The plural form of caudex, referring to the thickened stem of a palm or tree fern.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, the caudexes of the palm trees stood tall and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: Botanists study the caudexes of tree ferns to understand their growth patterns.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the caudexes of the palm trees as a hiding spot for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The caudexes of the tree ferns resembled ancient pillars holding up the forest canopy.
meanings.sent5: The thick caudexes of the palm trees looked like nature's own sculptures in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A group of caudexes, typically used in reference to a collection of plants.
meanings.sent1: The botanical garden displayed a variety of caudexes, showcasing different plant species.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners carefully arranged the caudexes of various plants to create a harmonious display.
meanings.sent3: During the plant exhibition, visitors marveled at the diverse caudexes on show.
meanings.sent4: The collection of caudexes in the greenhouse resembled a miniature forest in bloom.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the caudexes in the garden brightened up the surroundings.
